anytimeExactBeliefPropagation

Class PartitionTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • anytimeExactBeliefPropagation.PartitionTree

  • public class PartitionTree
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a partition tree for factors of a given Model. In the S-BP algorithm, each Node has it's own partition, and sees a given part of the graph. This is shown here by the attributes node and setOfFactorsInsidePartition. Those a partition of those setOfFactorsInsidePartition is found in the attribute parents. This means that the Union of p.setOfFactorsInsidePartition, for p in partition is equal to this.setOfFactorsInsidePartition.
    Author:
    ferreira

      • CreatePartitionTreeWithBFS

        public void CreatePartitionTreeWithBFS(Model model)
        This class creates a partition based on a BFS process. There are various ways to create the partition tree. In fact any partition tree will provide an exact inference. But some of them will generate so many separator variables (or cutset variables) that the inference time can be close to the Naive computation. The study of the complexity of choosing the optimal tree (or a good heuristic) still needs to be done in the project. (TODO) The choice of a BFS seems intuitively good because it distributes the nodes more or less evenly among the partitions
        Parameters:
        model -

      • printTree

        public void printTree(boolean PrintSetOfFactorsAlso)
        This will print on the standard output the nodes of the partition tree in a tree indentation. One if one wishes to print the setOfFactorsInsidePartition of each node, set PrintSetOfFactorsAlso to true, and otherwise false
        Parameters:
        PrintSetOfFactorsAlso -
